title: Introduction to R
text:
R


Programming Langulage
Other langulages: html, java, python
Purpose: Data and statistical analysis
What can be done: almost anything
Limitation: Memory usage

title: Introduction to R
text:
Getting Started

Install R from : https://www.r-project.org
Install Rstudio from : https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/
Also install Quarto: https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/

title: Introduction to R
text:
Learned


How to launch Rstudio
Components of Rstudio
Where to write code and where to execute it
File navigation

title: Introduction to R
text:
Assignment

Use either <- or =


x <- 3
print(x)

[1] 3



y = 5
y

[1] 5

title: Introduction to R
Introduction to R
text:
Special Class 1

x = 4
class(x)

[1] "numeric"

x = as.integer(x)
class(x)

[1] "integer"

title: Introduction to R
text:
Special Class 2

gender = sample(c('Male', 'Female'), size = 20, replace = T)
class(gender)

[1] "character"

gender = as.factor(gender)
# Use ?as.factor to get details 
class(gender)

[1] "factor"

title: Introduction to R
text:
Subset

Zila = sample(c('Munshiganj', 'Dhaka','Gazipur'), size = 10, replace = T)
Zila

 [1] "Munshiganj" "Dhaka"      "Gazipur"    "Dhaka"      "Dhaka"     
 [6] "Munshiganj" "Gazipur"    "Gazipur"    "Munshiganj" "Munshiganj"

Income = sample(40000:100000, size = 10, replace = T)
Income

 [1] 69998 72246 83364 90239 55265 59566 82285 77736 85912 66609

Zila == 'Munshiganj'

 [1]  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE

Income[Zila == 'Munshiganj']

[1] 69998 59566 85912 66609

title: Introduction to R
text:
Getting Help

?command

?sum
?for

??something

title: Introduction to R
text:
Reading

mydata = read.csv('~/Documents/All_R_projects/RStat4Arts/data/toy.example1.csv')
head(mydata)

   Person       Zila Income Gender
1 Person1 Munshiganj  20357   Male
2 Person2    Gazipur  16669 Female
3 Person3 Munshiganj  11668   Male
4 Person4 Munshiganj  26565   Male
5 Person5 Munshiganj  23465 Female
6 Person6    Gazipur  35057 Female

title: Introduction to R
text:
Excel File

install.packages('readxl')


library(readxl)
some_other_data = read_excel('../data/toy.example1.xlsx')
head(some_other_data)

# A tibble: 6 Ã— 4
  Person  Zila       Income Gender
  <chr>   <chr>       <dbl> <chr> 
1 Person1 Munshiganj  20357 Male  
2 Person2 Gazipur     16669 Female
3 Person3 Munshiganj  11668 Male  
4 Person4 Munshiganj  26565 Male  
5 Person5 Munshiganj  23465 Female
6 Person6 Gazipur     35057 Female

title: Introduction to R
text:
Without Loading Package

some.new.data <- readxl::read_excel('../data/toy.example1.xlsx')

title: Introduction to R
text:
Subset Data 6

interesting_persons = c("Person1", 'Person10', 'Person21', 'Person35')
mydata[mydata$Person%in%interesting_persons,]

     Person       Zila Income Gender
1   Person1 Munshiganj  20357   Male
10 Person10 Munshiganj  13676   Male
21 Person21      Dhaka  20654   Male
35 Person35    Gazipur  12810 Female

title: Introduction to R
text:
Add Variable

mydata$Family.Size = sample(1:10, nrow(mydata), replace = T)
head(mydata)

   Person       Zila Income Gender Family.Size
1 Person1 Munshiganj  20357   Male           2
2 Person2    Gazipur  16669 Female           3
3 Person3 Munshiganj  11668   Male           2
4 Person4 Munshiganj  26565   Male           9
5 Person5 Munshiganj  23465 Female           1
6 Person6    Gazipur  35057 Female           9

title: Introduction to R
text:
Add Variable

mydata$Per.Head.Income = mydata$Income/mydata$Family.Size

title: Introduction to R
text: Central Tendency

title: Course Materials
text:
Datasets
Slides

title: Basic Statistics in R for Arts
text: In this course I will introduce you to R, the wonderful and powerful programming language for statistical analysis, general data analysis, machine learning and many more. We will learn enough statistical background to run simple data analysis, visualization, hypothesis testing, linear models such as multiple linear regression, and logistic regression, etc.

title: Schedule
text:
Example schedule:









Morning
Afternoon




L
Intro + Data manipulation
git / GitHub


M
Generalised Linear Models
Data visualisation


X
Mixed models / GAM / Bayes
Functional programming + Students work


J
Multivariate analyses
Reproducible workflows


V
Using R as GIS + Students work
Project presentations
